cluster_relations.rel_desc: Gravitational waves are one of the cosmic phenomena being studied.
remarks: Slight ambiguity whether pronoun refers only to black holes or also their gravitational waves; relation added with moderate confidence.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Black holes are an example of cosmic phenomena mentioned in the text.

qualifiers.OtherQualifier: Category: large-scale astrophysical objects and events

remarks: Relation used to tie black holes to the broader cosmic phenomena category.

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject entity is an instance or example of the object category or type.
args.justification: Both relations describe a specific astrophysical entity (gravitational waves, black hole) as an example or member of the broader category 'cosmic phenomena', matching a standard instance–of / category-membership predicate.
args.remark: Direction is from concrete phenomenon to its broader astrophysical category.

args.justification: These relations link concrete astrophysical entities to a broader conceptual category, which is best modeled as category or class membership rather than mere association.
Instance-of / category-membership relations express taxonomic identity between an instance and its type, fitting the broad IDENTITY group rather than causality or composition.
